programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit the Palm Springs desert hoping for some hot profits. Mary sticks to a tight budget while Darrell is willing to spend big.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: As the season comes to an end, the final task for the crew is crafting a machete for Machete himself. Director Robert Rodriguez joins Danny Trejo for a demo.

credits.director: Robert Rodriguez joins Danny Trejo for a demo

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While Rick and Marty try to make sense of their finds so far, a new theory links the island to the Aztec Empire.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One team enters a dangerous canal only accessible by canoe in search of a prize alligator, while another heads for one of the toughest hunting spots.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: On the busiest travel week of the year, Al works to clear a burning trailer off the Coq and Colin rescues a delivery truck loaded with Christmas parcels.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare copy of Seven Years in Tibet signed by author Heinrich Harrer turns up at the shop, and Corey teams up with Chumlee to check out a Three Stooges promotional projector.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A collection of original 1960s NBC posters arrive at the shop, and the team is asked to appraise a 1966 Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: At the halfway stage, all contestants - except Phil Wang - are in with a chance of victory. Kerry Godliman and Jessica Knappett resort to soapy violence.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2004, with Alan Davies, Rich Hall, Mark Steel and Phill Jupitus facing the questions. As ever, host Stephen Fry will only award points for answers he finds interesting.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc takes over the reins for the extended edition of the topical quiz, with comedian Hal Cruttenden and writer Sathnam Sanghera joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the light-hearted panel show, which sees comedy actress Miranda Hart, TV and radio host Reggie Yates and Countryfile presenter John Craven competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include stuffed marrows, spitting, the hip-hop handshake and Miranda's breasts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: All Girls Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: A female-only special of the comedy show, showcasing some of the funniest women to have graced the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The programme features routines by Sara Pascoe, Sarah Millican, Lucy Porter, Roisin Conaty, Katherine Ryan, Ellie Taylor, Michelle Wolf, Jen Brister, Shappi Khorsandi, Francesca Martinez, Andi Osho and Celia Pacquola.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian tries his hand at four distinctly unglamorous jobs, beginning by getting up early to sample the life of a refuse collector on the streets of Barry, Vale of Glamorgan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day recreates the case of a soldier who returned from the front line of the Second World War with a terrible urge to kill.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two episodes from Balmoral, where she takes a tour of the grounds in a 1953 land rover and views archive footage of the royal family. Valuables brought in to be viewed include a collection of medals from both World Wars presented to a man who also rescued survivors from the Titanic, an art nouveau mirror and a 16th-century bottle that survived being unearthed by a digger.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the nation with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook to discover how the railways have affected people and what remains of Bradshaw's Britain. He begins by travelling from High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, to Stratford-upon-Avon in Warwickshire, finding out about the remarkable craftsmen behind the Victorian furniture trade, discovering how George Bradshaw helped save Britain's canal heritage and seeing Shakespeare through the eyes of a 19th-century rail tourist.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns how the railways helped to make Birmingham the pen-making capital of the world, hears the chilling tale of one of 19th-century Britain's most notorious murderers and samples delicacies concocted in a Victorian kitchen at Shugborough Hall, Staffordshire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a Christmas special from Lyme Park in Cheshire, where she and toy expert Will Farmer look back at children's Christmas presents dating back to Edwardian times. In the house's gardens, over 2000 visitors have arrived to have their items valued, including many with a royal heritage. The programme features a cup and saucer once owned by the Queen, a pram from Buckingham Palace, and a dagger believed to have been owned by Charles I. Plus, a celebration of the works of Charles Dickens.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: A look at Hitler's plans to build ambitious new cities in the countries he conquered, as well as schemes to transform Berlin to serve as a global capital city.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Stoke-on-Trent to Winsford, Cheshire, finding out about one of the greatest locomotive factories in railway history along the way. He also discovers the dark side of the Industrial Revolution and learns how Victorian potteries brought their products to the masses.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Dudley in the West Midlands to Bridgnorth, Shropshire. He learns how Victorian blacksmithing was not for the faint-hearted, rides on one of Britain's most modern trains and traverses the Victoria Bridge at Bewdley in Worcestershire.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn rides up Mount Snowdon's railway to visit the summit station, and discovers how a glass structure envelopes Strasbourg's 19th-century station.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie faces his worst nightmare when Marlene's sister decides to pay a visit from Peckham. As if the man-eating glamourpuss was not enough to cope with, he finds all his staff tied up in the barn - and realises his past has come back to haunt him. Guest starring Paula Wilcox.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A visit to a local country mansion reveals Boycie's admiration for the long-established tradition of respect for the gentry. Elgin moves into Bryan's caravan after being thrown out by his wife, leading to relentless gossiping by Mrs Cakeworthy. When the mobile home burns down Marlene offers the two men a place to stay, much to her husband's chagrin. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Home Office asks Sam and her team to re-examine the work of an independent pathologist. Harry's patience is tested to the limit by the investigation. Feature-length crime drama, starring Amanda Burton, Mick Ford and William Armstrong.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote goes metal detecting. Meanwhile, A fire that has broken out at a house ends in tragedy, and Gregg steals the show at Jaffa's talent contest.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colette is overjoyed to learn that the Fusiliers will shortly be leaving for South Africa, and tries to persuade Joe that it would be the ideal place to get married. Marsha learns that Michael has been having an affair and resolves to fight for him, no matter what it takes.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads reach South Africa where they help complete the building of a medical centre, leading to romance for Jeremy, who falls for one of the nurses. Meanwhile, Andy Butcher lands himself in deep trouble after a kind-hearted gesture to help a destitute local family leads to accusations of ivory-poaching.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: New consultant Dan continues to put pressure on Abra while he is digging for dirt about the kidney transplant. Sam locks horns with Connie over the future of their baby and Mark punishes himself for Tricia's death. Medical drama, starring Peter Wingfield and Adrian Edmondson.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Spencer runs into an old Navy colleague while attending a funeral - only to find he has a much younger, pregnant fiancee whose father is hot on his heels. Patrick arrives when the girl is suffering chest pains, and the pair are held hostage by the disapproving parent. Medical drama series, starring Ian Kelsey and Ben Keaton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A ghost from Kathy's past returns to haunt her, Richard has a date with an old flame, and Mark is exasperated by Shelley's behaviour.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy makes a decision which changes her life, while Ricky leaves Frank speechless when he describes his new job.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch face a tough challenge when a fire breaks out in an indoor market. Meanwhile, Carol takes romance a step further.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack is caught in a dilemma when he has to tell his best friends that Chloe has cancer, and his relationship with Beth continues to deteriorate, prompting her to make radical decisions about her future. Drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally bans Megan from seeing Luke and makes her feelings about her daughter's pregnancy very clear, which only serves to bring the teenagers closer together. A team-building exercise for the factory workers reaches a dramatic climax and the nurses help a woman suffering from alopecia come clean about her relationship with a younger man. Guest starring Jan Francis and Chris Bisson.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey discovers more than she bargained for while sorting out jumble for a car-boot sale after chancing upon an old photo album. Linda Robson stars.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: DeVere moves his multinational grocery business to the manor and clashes with Audrey over the removal of a fireplace that he considers ugly and she believes is intrinsic to the property. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An afternoon driving around in Wesley's car proves to be tough on the feet. Compo is suffering from hard skin and places his faith in a herbal jelly from a gypsy healer. Bill Owen stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Seymour visit an old friend in hospital following his hernia operation and go to extraordinary lengths to cheer him up. Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge star in the first episode to feature Clem 'Smiler' Hemmingway (Stephen Lewis).

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge must decide the fate of a sick baby which has been refused further resuscitation by doctors. The infant's deeply religious parents disagree, and take the fight for their son's life to court. Meanwhile, a boy convicted of theft dies in custody - bringing Deed's own traumatic memories of childhood to the fore. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Amanda Burton's last appearance as forensic pathologist Professor Sam Ryan. When the bodies of two men are exposed by a landslide in Ireland, the subsequent investigation suggests the pair died in the sectarian violence of the 1970s, prompting Sam to make a long overdue and painful journey home. Bryan Murray, William Gaminara and Tom Ward also star.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Contestants have five minutes to artistically slice avocados, before a complex butchery, filleting or shellfish prep round, and a final test involving the ultimate prawn dish. Fern Britton hosts, with Phil Vickery as guest chef.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, which sees five Doctor Who fans from Liverpool competing to answer questions on subjects including Monty Python, English monarchs and classic comics. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Michael, Callum, Charmain and Liz pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Portwenn is abuzz with activity for the preparation of Janice and Penhale's wedding, but a medical issue could prevent Penhale from making it down the aisle. Meanwhile, Al is struggling with the demands of being best man, especially when Bert's marketing antics mean there is only whisky available at the pre-wedding party. Martin Clunes and John Marquez star.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the quiz, with six more contestants competing in Fastest Finger First to see who will sit in the hot seat and have the chance to take home the £1million jackpot. To make things easier, the players have four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong's Land of the Midnight Sun
programme.desc: The television presenter and comedian takes on an epic 8,000-mile journey halfway around the Arctic Circle deep in mid-winter, a spectacular but deadly time of year to see the unforgiving, ice-bound region. His odyssey is full of surprises as he witnesses natural wonders and discovers the magnetic lure of the far north. The first edition sees Alexander begin in Scandinavia and head toward Iceland, as he swims with locals in the ocean, faces the worst storm in 25 years, and goes down the world's first major tunnel to be built into the heart of a glacier.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the heart-stopping story of a man who took a ‘pleasure flight' on a hang-glider. Two passengers on board the Viking Sky cruise ship that suffered engine failure in rough seas just off the coast of Norway recount how they were left fearing for their lives, while a heroic cop throws the rulebook out of the window when trying to save a baby's life on the roadside.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: In the sixth and final episode, the brothers prepare to say their goodbyes to Mumbai, but before they leave, they are invited to appear on a local news report. For their final stop in the city, the boys meet 85-year-old Norma Otter, who was a team-mate of Dougie's international hockey star aunt, Pansy Thomas. Following the meeting, the boys decide to take on a junior girl's hockey team who are training nearby. As their adventure draws to a close, the family arrive in Jejuri in the midst of the 100,000 festival goers who are there to take part in what is known as the Golden Festival.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How tunnels are built and the secret of the lion dance. Plus, a device that removes rain water from sports fields, allowing play to resume faster.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer settles for a Volkswagen T2 panel van after his budget proves too tight for a classic Camper, and mechanic Edd China agrees to ambitious plans concerning its renovation.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Just outside Washington DC, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a stash of untouched inventory from one of the US' oldest bicycle and sporting goods store.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paul Teutul Sr's vintage bike is unveiled to the public at a magazine photoshoot, and Chris Matthews completes his restoration of a classic machine.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Luke flies dangerous chemicals to a remote village, and when winter claims its first victim in Unalakleet, Jim makes arrangements to transport the casket.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins the assembly line in Idaho degreasing a train engine's blocks. Later, he gets behind the wheel and endeavours to keep the locomotive on the tracks.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How coffee machines, mascots, hammocks and traditional bows are made, and the ways in which manufacturing processes have been affected by technological progress.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How glass fibre insulation, bubblegum machines and exhaust systems are made and the ways in which these methods have progressed as technology has developed.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of 99 per cent of America's raisins in California's San Joaquin Valley. Plus, the manufacture of the world's oldest type of paper.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, Henry and Sam find a shed full of different items. Sam has his eye on some model trains, while Henry finds a vintage bike.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are rummaging about in a tractor enthusiast's heaven - fields full of tractors and machinery, some in mint condition and others buried under weeds, hedges and grass.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The polar ice pack makes work difficult in the opilio grounds, forcing captains throughout the fleet to make a tough decision on whether to stay and battle the elements or return to port.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie team the Young Guns have a life-threatening moment hunting legendary pineapple opal. The Cooke Bros scramble to hunt on another miner's claim for a share of the find.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Yorkshire, efforts to demolish a famous flour mill are frustrated by freak weather conditions. Plus, in Derbyshire, a pub spooks the team trying to tear it down.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Porsche Boxster for £1,000 - despite it having seized brakes and mould on its roof. Expert mechanic Edd China tries to determine the cause of the faults so the pair can make the necessary repairs and trade it on at a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits the Lee Roy Hartung collection, where he discovers an original Hertz car from the 1920s and a one-off 1949 Veritas.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini hopes a fishing rod and canoe will add to the value of his 1939 Ford Standard Woodie Wagon.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An in-depth insight into the mechanical capabilities and basic building processes behind BMW's distinctive Mini range.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie team the Young Guns have a life-threatening moment hunting legendary pineapple opal. The Cooke Bros scramble to hunt on another miner's claim for a share of the find.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: One of the boats suffers a total blackout while navigating a stretch of water riddled with icebergs. Meanwhile Elliott gets a rude awakening, and a rookie fisherman learns an important lesson.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank Fritz jumps for joy as he and Mike Wolfe pick a recently closed toy museum that is ready to sell its collection of treasures.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits the medieval Ely Cathedral in Cambridgeshire and finds pew connected a great Victorian architect. Later, he finds a Second World War bomber crew seat at an aviation museum.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Yorkshire, a team struggles to pull apart a retired yacht. In Lewisham, south London, a tower block is demolished, while in Lancashire a tractor reveals treasure.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer settles for a Volkswagen T2 panel van after his budget proves too tight for a classic Camper, and mechanic Edd China agrees to ambitious plans concerning its renovation.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New mining team The Tunnel Rats blasts its way to a fortune and solo prospector Col Duff gets stranded deep in the Queensland outback. Rookie Sam runs out of air underground.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard mixes with aristocracy at a Cornwall estate where he is blown away by a collection of classic cars. In Newark, Nottinghamshire, he finds a huge hoard of enamel signs for the oil industry.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The team's morning banter is interrupted by a retired Airbus A320 arriving from Estonia. Plus, an unusual request comes in from a diving instructor for a highly durable item.

programme.title: Steel Buddies
programme.desc: Michael flies an old Russian Antonov from Germany to America, an incredible journey of 6,500km, without radar, in what could be his most dangerous mission yet.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating radars. Plus, the production of pistachios.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how wrecker trucks are built, the production of Roquefort and the transportation of trees.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI is alerted when a female Army officer fails to report for work and a mysterious bloodstain is found at her home. Her husband comes under suspicion of murder because of his violent history, but the investigators find little evidence to implicate him.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A forensic anthropologist identifies human remains found in the Mississippi River, and a professor uses a combination of bones and mathematics to solve a murder.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In February 2015, the body of 26-year-old Celina Petersen was found dumped in an alley in South Park, Seattle. When police recovered surveillance footage from across the neighbourhood, they began to unravel the shocking truth behind her murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two young women failed to return home from the local drive-thru. As their parents began a search for them, a fisherman gave police their first clue.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents search for a young girl abducted on a camping trip - and their investigation is helped by the numerous phone calls the kidnapper makes to the victim's mother.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team discovers a shocking case of animal cruelty when a neglected horse suffers a fatal injury.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a tiny dog with a big growth on her leg. Colleague Tim attempts to get a world-famous crocodile out of the water to look at his injured foot.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride would like an azalea green dress, but her sister has different ideas. Plus, a woman tries to convince her sibling to wear a dress for the first time in 15 years.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride's dream dress is on the line when her mother's budget is challenged, while another customer is an only child and used to getting what she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Robin and Flo make a major faux pas by having two sisters model their wedding dresses for their family side by side.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits are given 800 euros to spend at an antiques market in picturesque Beziers, one of the oldest cities in France, all under the watchful eye of expert dealer Mark Franks.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Managing director James shocks the team by offering free valuations for charity in this festive special. Model and entrepreneur Caprice sells a designer dress for a worthy cause, while a French mother is stunned when she learns more about a diamond-encrusted necklace she wants to sell to raise £20,000 for Christmas. Lawrence gets excited when a grandfather turns up with a signed Manny Pacquiao boxing glove, and the staff get ready for the office party with a surprise visit from a Secret Santa.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Officers from the Pennsylvania SPCA respond to a call concerning abandoned animals, but are unprepared for what they discover inside a fridge.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A massive dog fighting operation leads the Pennsylvania SPCA's Humane Law Enforcement team to exhume the front yard of a property.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The tools of detection are at the forefront of technology. This programme reveals the groundbreaking techniques being employed to catch deadly killers.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How, after the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, DNA was traced to the bomber through the saliva that remained on the back of a mailing label.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 16-year-old Molly Bish, who vanished minutes after reporting for her summer job as a lifeguard in June 2000. Her body was found three years later after the largest search in the history of Massachusetts.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-three Patty Vaughan, whose blood-stained minivan was found abandoned at a roadside on Christmas Day 1996, 20 miles from her home in Texas. Police considered the possible involvement of her ex-husband in her disappearance.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The actress investigates two killings, believed to be linked. One year after a woman was found murdered in a motel, police began to think they would never uncover the truth - until another woman disappeared.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Aspiring country music star Whitney Duncan wants a romantic lace gown that gives her some curves, while a bride with a larger-than-life personality looks for a dress to match.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having tried on 100 gowns, Lisa is still looking for her ideal outfit, while Brittany is determined to wear pink on her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: With Alaska coming up short, Liz has flown 4,000 miles to find a dress, while Amanda has exhausted all options in Europe and has high hopes for the salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Erin wants a blue dress for her wedding, but must persuade her sceptical entourage, while Kate goes in search of a unique gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Petite bride Christine hopes to find a gown to match her 1920s-themed wedding, while Valentina returns for her fitting to add a personal touch to her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dorothy's friend Danielle has a surprise in store, while consultant Katie is delighted to turn customer for the day.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: Your Mum's Been Here the Whole Time
programme.desc: One woman hears shocking news about her biological family, while another finds she may have been connected to the mother she tried to find for years.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lisa's struggle with her weight began as a child and worsened after witnessing her brother's murder. Now bedridden, she is unable to care for herself.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.desc: Ed's daughters express their concerns ahead of his surgery. Meanwhile, the family unites to support Amy on her tough road to recovery.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A woman with a condition called Familial Partial Lipodystrophy, which causes her to hold all of her fat around her face and neck.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A woman who has suffered with facial paralysis for 30 years seeks surgical help to rebuild her confidence and restore her self-esteem.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a businessman who flew to Florida to make a million-dollar deal but was never seen again, leaving the FBI with few leads to follow.
